intro: Coelorachis rottboellioides var. intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate coelorachis, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a prominent corona, contributing to its ornamental value. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
